column5: SEOUL South Korea's LG Display Co Ltd plans to invest up to 900 billion won ($802.75 million) to build a new production line for small- and medium-sized organic light emitting diode (OLED) displays  the DongA Ilbo newspaper reported on Monday.

column4: LG Display to invest up to $803 mln for new OLED panel line - DongA Ilbo
column5: SEOUL  July 6 South Korea's LG Display Co Ltd  plans to invest up to 900 billion won ($802.75 million) to build a new production line for small- and medium-sized organic light emitting diode (OLED) displays  the DongA Ilbo newspaper reported on Monday.

column4: Manulife Bank to install 830 automated banking machines across Canada
column5: TORONTO  July 6 Manulife Financial Corp's  banking unit is planning to install about 830 automated banking machines across Canada  as it attempts to take a bigger share of the nation's retail banking market.

column4: Canada's Manulife to delay Singapore REIT listing due to market conditions
column5: SINGAPORE  July 6 Canada's Manulife Financial Corp said on Monday it was delaying a plan to raise $421 million through a Singapore listing of a real estate investment trust (REIT)  citing unfavourable market conditions.

column4: Canada's Manulife shelves Singapore REIT IPO: IFR
column5: SINGAPORE Canada's Manulife Financial Corp has shelved its plan to raise $421 million through a Singapore listing of a real estate investment trust (REIT) backed by three U.S. office properties  IFR reported on Monday.

column4: EIB in talks to lend more than $500 mln to Polish power firm PGE
column5: WARSAW  July 6 The European Investment Bank (EIB) is in advanced talks to lend more than 2 billion zlotys ($526 million) to Poland's biggest power producer PGE  to help finance its investments  the head of the EIB's Warsaw office told Reuters.

column4: Brazil's Petrobras must pay higher royalty in Whale Park dispute
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO Brazil's state-run Petrobras said on Monday it must pay the Brazilian government about 350 million reais ($112 million) of additional royalties a quarter for oil produced in seven offshore fields.

column4: Brazil's Petrobras must pay higher royalty in Whale Park dispute
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  July 6 Brazil's state-run Petrobras said on Monday it must pay the Brazilian government about 350 million reais ($112 million) of additional royalties a quarter for oil produced in seven offshore fields.

column4: UPDATE 1-Petrobras CEO says ethanol key to reducing gasoline imports
column5: SAO PAULO  July 6 Aldemir Bendine  chief executive of Brazil's state-run oil firm Petrobras  said on Monday that ethanol biofuel would be key to reducing the company's dependence on imported gasoline.

column4: Petrobras CEO says ethanol key to reducing gasoline imports
column5: SAO PAULO  July 6 Aldemir Bendine  CEO of Brazil's state-run oil firm Petrobras  said on Monday he did not want the company to depend excessively on imported gasoline and that ethanol biofuel would be key to reducing that dependence.

column4: Petrobras may sell Braskem stake  build tax provisions  Valor says
column5: SAO PAULO  July 6 State-controlled oil producer Petróleo Brasileiro SA could sell a stake in Brazil's Braskem SA and build provisions against tax debts nearing 40 billion reais ($12.7 billion) to reduce costs and make finances sustainable  Valor Econômico newspaper said on Monday.

column4: Philip Morris to cut stake in Indonesian unit  could raise over $1 billion
column5: JAKARTA/SINGAPORE U.S. cigarette giant Philip Morris International Inc  plans to sell a stake worth at least $1 billion in Indonesian unit PT HM Sampoerna Tbk  to comply with free-float rules  two people familiar with the matter said on Monday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Philip Morris to cut stake in Indonesian unit  could raise over $1 bln-sources
column5: * Philip Morris eyes stake sale in unit to comply with local rules

column4: Philip Morris seeks at least $1 bln from stake sale in Indonesia unit -WSJ
column5: JAKARTA  July 6 U.S. cigarette giant Philip Morris International Inc plans to sell shares worth more than $1 billion in Indonesia's PT HM Sampoerna Tbk  the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday  citing people familiar with the matter.

column4: Exclusive: Britain targets sale of half its RBS stake in two years - sources
column5: LONDON Britain is planning to sell half its stake in Royal Bank of Scotland   worth 16 billion pounds ($25 billion)  within two years of a possible first sale in September  sources with knowledge of government thinking told Reuters.

column4: RBS could face $13 billion bill in U.S. mortgage bond case -court filings
column5: LONDON State-backed Royal Bank of Scotland  may need to pay $13 billion to settle claims it misled investors in mortgage-backed securities  according to documents filed in a U.S. court.

column4: Statoil awards 1.5 bln crown drilling contract to Baker Hughes
column5: OSLO  July 6 Norway's oil and gas firm Statoil  said on Monday it has awarded Baker Hughes a 1.5 billion Norwegian crown  ($187.20 million) contract for integrated drilling services at Johan Sverdrup field.

column5: NEW YORK Humana Inc  fresh from announcing an agreement to be purchased by larger rival Aetna Inc  prompted new investor concerns about the $33 billion deal on Monday by lowering its 2015 financial forecasts.

column5: LOS ANGELES The "happiest place on Earth" will keep a special tax exemption in Anaheim  California  for 30 more years if the City Council approves the Walt Disney Co's plan for a $1 billion-plus expansion of its theme park complex in the city.

column5: Three major securities brokerages must collectively reimburse customers more than $30 million for failing to waive mutual fund sales charges for thousands of accounts belonging to charities and retirement investors  Wall Street's watchdog said on Monday.

column5: Denison Mines Corp  on Monday agreed to buy competitor Fission Uranium Corp  for around C$483 million ($381.97 million)  creating a diversified Canadian uranium company with projects centered on the Northern Saskatchewan region.
